''Of shoes - and ships - and sealing wax / Of ... - and kings'' (Lewis Carroll)
FOUND IN: It sets the tone for the absurd and fantastical world that Carroll creates, where "shoes" and "ships" might be related in some unexpected way, and where "cabbages" and "kings" are brought together in a similarly illogical fashion.
Knight (a horse's head is a common way to describe the knight piece in chess)
